transcript.text: People sometimes ask why the trade requirements are so strict – and why the penalties are so severe. Companies who violate trade compliance laws sometimes have to pay millions in fines, and could also be excluded from future government contracts and international business.

panelText.text: The penalties for violating trade compliance laws can be substantial.

• Companies can have their goods seized, pay millions in fines and even be barred from doing future business.
  • Governments impose trade controls to support economic or strategic goals, or protect national security; to deter violations, they impose severe penalties.
  • International organizations, like the UN, also impose trade controls, often to encourage democratic principles or punish those who violate human rights.
  • Trade regulations are a complex issue for global businesses, because the rules vary from country to country – and they can change quickly in response to current events.
